pair.Response:
Prompt: Northern Securities Co. v. United States (1903)
Response: In this case, the Supreme Court of the United States held that the formation of the Northern Securities Company and the acquirement by it of stock of the two railroad companies was a lawful transaction, governed solely by local state laws, and not in contravention of any provision of the Federal Constitution or statutes. The court also held that the acts of the defendants were all done in good faith, without any purpose to destroy competition or restrain trade. The case was decided on October Term, 1903.
